question: Which is the only country in the world that forms the habitat of "Gelada Monkey"?
explanation: Gelada Monkey, also known as a bleeding-heart monkey or the gelada baboon, is an old-world monkey species only found in the Ethiopian Highlands, especially in the Semien Mountains of Ethiopia. IUCN's Red List of Threatened Species classified it as a "Least Concern" species. Geladas are the only primates that are primarily graminivores and grazers-grass blades make up to 90% of their diet.
